intro: Paropsia vareciformis, commonly known as the variable leaf paropsia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves that vary in shape and size. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
